quest.name: Seeking Counsel
journal: Alphinaud is eager to assist Captain Lyna.
objectives: Speak with Lyna at Fort Jobb in Lakeland.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: It may simply be my imagination, but Lyna has been rather...brusque with me of late. You don't suppose she's still upset over that mishap with the salmon fillet, do you?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: To think we will not only have Zenos to contend with once we return, but a new Ultima Weapon as well. <sigh> Why must all of our enemies insist on returning from their graves?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Upon white auracite's crystalline foundation we have built not a prison, but a refuge for the soul. Would that Moenbryda were here to see the wonders inspired by her research.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Never have I seen such a repository of knowledge. A stark reminder what little we truly know of the world.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I must confess, while I enjoy my fair share of scholarly research, it will be good to step outside for a spot of fresh air.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Now, then─shall we go and speak with Lyna?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I suggest we hurry. Lyna does not strike me as one who enjoys being made to wait.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: We have little time, so I will be brief. A sin eater has been sighted in Lakeland, and I ask for your assistance in slaying it.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A sin eater? I had heard some few yet remained after the night had returned, but...perhaps we should call the others.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: That will not be necessary. It is only a single sin eater. A simple task for our guard, I should think.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: That said, I believe fighting alongside the Warrior of Darkness would be a valuable experience for them.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Peace can lead to complacency, and they gain nothing from an easy victory. But you do not underestimate your foes, however harmless they may seem. My men would do well to learn from your example.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Let's be about it, then.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Me? Why not Alphinaud?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You cannot be serious. Come now, Forename─what could be more inspiring than fighting alongside the renowned Warrior of Darkness herselfhimself?

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Excellent. Then let us make for Fort Jobb.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The sin eaters that remain no longer have a leader to guide them, but they are no less dangerous. They cannot be suffered to live.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: If you would wait here a moment, I will gather the others.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: You may not remember, but you have met these soldiers once before, though only in passing.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Long have they awaited the opportunity to fight at your side.

dialogue.name: INJUREDB03607
dialogue.text: I was at death's door that day after the sin eaters attacked. If you and yours hadn't come along, I'd have likely stepped through. And I wouldn't have been alone.

dialogue.name: INJUREDB03607
dialogue.text: Your courage and selflessness is something we all aspire to.

dialogue.name: INJUREDC03607
dialogue.text: I too was there that terrible day. My friend was transformed into a sin eater before my very eyes, and I had no choice but to cut her down. The thought of returning to the field, of holding a blade again─it filled me with dread.

dialogue.name: INJUREDC03607
dialogue.text: But that is no way to honor her or my comrades. And so I have returned! I swear I will not let you or anyone else down from this day forward.

dialogue.name: CRYSTARIUMGARDPICKET
dialogue.text: A pleasure to meet you, misssir. Truly. It seems like only yesterday I watched as you took flight astride an amaro to go and save the Oracle.

dialogue.name: CRYSTARIUMGARDPICKET
dialogue.text: Strange to think the Eulmoran soldiers we once locked blades with are now on our side, but we will do our utmost to keep the peace here in Lakeland.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: We seem to be missing one─

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: (-Honest Soldier-)My apologies, Captain Lyna. An elderly gentleman asked that I escort him to Clearmelt. It...took longer than I anticipated.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: I'll not begrudge your desire to help those in need, but a soldier must be punctual. Especially when we play host to honored guests.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: (-Honest Soldier-)It won't happen again.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: The name's Theyler. I'm sure you don't remember, but we met once before in the infirmary.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: I asked you to deliver a message to the Exarch and the Warrior of Darkness. Little did I know I was already talking to herhim.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: Don't give up. Don't give in. I keep those words close to my heart. And the boundless, beautiful skies above serve as a reminder of their importance.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: My friend got to see the night's return shortly before he passed. He left this world with a smile, satisfied with a glimpse of what was to come.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: But there are countless others who weren't so fortunate.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: They gave their lives for the promise of a future they'll never know. And so it falls to us to do everything we can to fulfill that promise.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER03608
dialogue.text: No matter what happens, we won't give up. We won't give in!

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Your heroism has inspired all of our guardsmen in much the same manner.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Our scouts at the Northern Staging Point have not had the pleasure of meeting you in person.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Let us not keep them waiting.

dialogue.name: BRAVESOLDIER
dialogue.text: If I hadn't seen him with my own eyes, I'd have sworn it was you who killed that sin eater.
